pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.35: See [pli-tv-kd18:1.2.22]() for the correct interpretation of this line.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.1: _Mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū_ can be read either as referring to two monks, Mettiya and Bhūmajaka, or as a group of monks led by these two. I have not been able to find any clear evidence that it refers to a group, and so I prefer the more straightforward reading that it only refers to the two monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.14: “Gatehouse” renders _koṭṭhaka_. See Appendix I: Technical Terms for discussion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.21: For the rendering of _saṅghāṭi_ as “upper robe”, see Appendix I: Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.19: “Rapist” renders _dūsita_. See _dūseti_ in Appendix I: Technical Terms for discussion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.13: “Expel” renders _nāsetha_. For a discussion of the verb _nāseti_, see Appendix I: Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.4: It is interesting to note that both _uposatha_ and _pavāraṇā_ are here used as distinct from _saṅghakamma_, suggesting neither was regarded as _saṅghakamma_ proper. See Appendix I: Technical Terms for a further discussion of these two words.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.4.2: Sp 1.387: _No kappetīti na saddahati_, “_No kappeti_: he does not believe.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.6: See [pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.33]() for the rule on abusive speech.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.4.6: See [pli-tv-bu-vb-pc2:1.2.33]() for the rule on abusive speech.
